page.title: 14Ships and Jetties.
page.content: There are two limestone quarries in our area,each with its own jetty. Powell Duffryn Quarries have their own fleet,called the Gem Line,named after precious stones.Ships come from N.Ire- land and the U.K. coast.The company was started by Robertson's of Robert- son's Research.Working on the jetty are loaders and unloaders.These are skilled jobs as they must know the sea movements well.Ships need a draught of 19' to come alongside. A.R.C.Rayne's Quarry has one ship, the Sand Skua,which takes all grades of limestone to Germany,Norway,Sweden and N.Europe.This ship makes about 6 calls a week,with foreign ships call- ing about twice a week.Three loaders work this jetty,which has been open 18 months,and replaced the previous jetty,which was 84 years old.
